wǒ: (Wǒ) hěn hǎo xìng rèn shi nǐ.
Wǒ men qù chí fàn ba!

I/me: I am leaving. / I need to go.
Are you done? Are you ready?

wǒ: Wǒ shi xuéshēng. Wǒ bú shi lǎoshī.
I/me: I am a student. I am not a teacher.

wǒ: Wǒ shi xuéshēng, bú shì lǎoshī.
I/me: I am a student, not a teacher.
We all do not have books.
I have two cups of tea.

wǒ: Ni yào chá ma? = Ni yào bú yào chá?
Nǐ huì yóuyǒng ma? = Nǐ huì bú huì yóuyǒng?

I/me: We all do not like him.

wǒ: Tāmen bù dōu shì Yìnní rén.
Tāmen dōu bú shì Yìnní rén.

I/me: I like to eat bun very much.
I do not like to eat bun.

wǒ: Wǒ bbù tài xǐhuān chī bāozi.
I/me: I do not like to eat bun very much.

wǒ: Nǐ tàitài xǐhuān h1e chá ma?
I/me: Does your wife like to drink tea?

wǒ: Nǐ xiānshēng xǐhuān kàn diànyǐng ma?
I/me: Does your husband like to go to a movie?

wǒ: Nǐ gěi wǒ nǐde hào mā?
Yì bēi nǎichá jǐ kuài qián?
I/me: How much is a cup of milk tea?

wǒ: Wǒ de péng yǒu de shǒu jī

I/me: He is eating a bread right now.
Will you go to night market (with me)?
Where did she buy the water?
I went to a night market to buy clothes.

wǒ: Wǒ zuótiān zài yèshì mǎi yīfú.
I/me: I went to a night market to buy clothes yesterday.

wǒ: Wǒ yào qù yèshì mǎi yīfú.
I/me: I want to go to a night market to buy clothes.

wǒ: Wǒ míngtiān yào qù yèshì mǎi yīfú.
I/me: I will go to a night market to buy clothes tomorrow.
We are all in the classroom.

wǒ: Shuǐ kāfēi hé chá wǒ dōu xǐhuān.
I/me: Water, coffee and tea, I like them all.

wǒ: Wǒ xǐhuān chá, kěshì bùxǐhuān píjiǔ.
I/me: I like tea but not beer.
He is busy but not tired.

wǒ: Tā hěn kě, kěshì bú è.
I/me: He is thirsty but not hungry.

wǒ: Nǐ xǐhuān chē shuǐ hái chá?
I/me: Do you like to dink water or tea?

wǒ: Wǒ yaò kāfēi huò shì chá.

I/me: The weather is very good today.

wǒ: Něi liàng chē shì Déguó chē?
I/me: Which car is a German car?

wǒ: Tā mǎi le hěn duō shuǐguǒ.
Tā Jīntiān maǐ le hěn duō shuǐguǒ.

I/me: This cell phone is too expensive.

wǒ: Zhèi shuāng tàixiǎo, wǒ yào dà yidiǎn de.
I/me: This pair is too small, I want a bigger  one.

wǒ: Nèi jiàn tài duǎn, chang yìdiǎn.
I/me: That one is too short, longer.
That pen is good to write.
Beef noodles are tasty.(good to eat)
Which kind of things are disgusting?

wǒ: Yìzhī bǐ, liǎngběn shū, yígòng duōshǎo qián?
I/me: A pen, two books, altogether how much are they?
